NOTICE_DATA.ORIGINAL_CPV: Other community, social and personal services

SHORT_DESCR.P: The Employment Support Pilot is a 3-year programme scheduled to commence in June 2018, aimed at tackling unemployment and low pay within 9 communities across the WMCA. The intention is for the pilot to be embedded within communities, engaging individuals who are 16 plus, from day 1 to long-term unemployed supporting individuals into sustainable employment opportunities. The other area of focus will be working with individuals on low incomes to increase their wage. The WMCA is looking for an inclusive community response, providing both pre and post-employment support promoting “community support for work”. The pilot will have a payment by results model based on engagement, job attainment, job sustainment and job progression. The WMCA would welcome interest from individual organisations or partnerships who can demonstrate an understanding of the identified communities needs an allied to experience for the transitioning customers to sustainable employment.

LOT_COMBINING_CONTRACT_RIGHT.P: Bidders may be awarded up to a maximum of 3 Lots in any combination. The duration of the contacts will be for 3 years (extendable subject to specific lot requirements).

MAIN_SITE.P: Delivery of services must primarily occur within the geographical communities of each designated Lot area. Please refer to the Authority’s ITT documents for specific definitions of the geographical co.

SHORT_DESCR.P: To deliver a 3-year programme scheduled to commence in June 2018, aimed at tackling unemployment and low pay within each designated Lot area. The intended delivery of the pilot will be to engage with individuals who are 16 plus and unemployed, focusing on a range of lengths of unemployment from day 1 to over 2 years, supporting individuals into sustainable employment opportunities. Whilst the other element of the contract will be working with those individuals who are on low incomes to increase their wage. The WMCA would welcome interest from individual organisations and communities who can demonstrate an understanding of the needs of these communities and with experience of working with supporting individuals into employment.

PERFORMANCE_CONDITIONS.P: The contract will be subject to minimum performance conditions relating to the number of beneficiaries achieving employability outcomes from the services delivered. Full details are provided in the Authority’s ITT documents.

REVIEW_PROCEDURE.P: Set out within the ITT documentation.
